column1: I stayed here during SXSW and had a really pleasant stay. The house is a very relaxing environment and Paddy is both a friendly and professional host.

Great place, close enough to everything downtown Austin has, yet just far enough to be relaxing and quiet. An excellent place to regroup and recharge. Paddy respected my privacy and different hours. The place is clean and hip - I would stay with Paddy again. You must be okay with dogs.

We had a great time in Austin staying at Paddy's house. The house is much larger than it looks on the photos, very clean and the moment you step in you feel like home. Wouldn't hesitate to stay there again next time I'm back in Austin.

We had a great stay at Zen East for South By Southwest! Paddy was extremely accommodating and we found the place to be exotic and homely. It was easy to settle right in and experience Austin, and everything was a short taxi or bus ride away. She had everything we needed for our stay, and we loved the zen vibe of the backyard garden.

I arrived late in the evening so did not meet Paddy, but her home was lovely and clean and welcoming. She checked in with my friend and I most days to make sure that we had no questions or needed anything. All in all, a very smooth, stress-free experience in Austin!
Very nice, took me to the co-op healthy grocery and gave rides when possible. Has a sweet little dog and a lovely home to share.
Paddy was very professional but also friendly. The house was lovely, the location was really perfect, and her dog Diego is very cute.

Paddy's home is charming and she is a very gracious host. She was kind enough to walk me around the neighborhood and make me feel at home.\r\r\r\rAt first I thought the location was a bit far from downtown, but there's a bus route that is a mere 2-blocks from her house and it takes all of 10-minutes to get to The Capital. Biking in the area is great too; it's about a 15-minute bike ride to/from Downtown. Paddy was kind enough to drive me to a bike rental shop.\r\r\r\rThe neighborhood is a bit eclectic with a mixture of Austin locals, artists and activists. I was fortunate to be there the same weekend as East Austin Studio Tours (EAST), which gave me a chance to explore that section of Austin. Paddy & I went to an outdoor performance that was a few blocks from her home, which was fantastic.\r\r\r\rPS: Diego is a cutie.
Paddy couldn't have been a more accommodating host. Her place was comfortable and near the rail line for quick access to downtown. All and all it was a great place to stay.

I had a very pleasant stay in Austin and Paddy was quite friendly and helpful. She helped me find some places in the neighborhood (which I enjoyed staying in), and her place was like a relaxing oasis. I would definitely stay here again.

Let me start off by saying that Elizabeth and David are amazing people to get to know, they are very helpful and are great hosts! The area in NW is peaceful, the house is beautiful and cozy and I love the backyard. I will highly recommend my family and friends and anyone to stay with them while visiting Austin.
David and Elizabeth are nice friendly people and their house is in a nice quiet neighborhood. I enjoyed my stay there and the room was comfortable and clean.
Nice home in a quiet neighborhood. Very hospitable. Extremely comfortable bed. Would stay here again.

On this visit, I noticed amenities that had been there before, but we just did not see. There were tea and hot cocoa pouches with mints, cups, and even fresh fruit, like a classy hotel. Sadly, somebody else booked additional days I wanted.

Elizabeth was an excellent host! We felt welcomed and comfortable the moment we entered her home. She even left amenities for us, including guides to what was nearby and a map of Austin which was very helpful. The house was in a safe location and it was easy to get to downtown. We would absolutely recommend Elizabeth to anyone who needs a place to stay in Austin.
Great people, great place!

What a pleasant surprise it was to have such a lovely room to stay in with all of the amenities! It was great visiting with the host family and getting to know them as well. Elizabeth was quick to answer my calls and texts and readily communicated without a problem. Looking forward to the next time I'm in that neck of the woods so I can stay again.
WONDERFUL stay! Loved her dog so much!
I enjoyed my brief stay and hope to visit again-this time longer. They took care of all the little details and I felt very welcomed.

I didn't have the opportunity to meet Elizabeth, but the communication was very good and she made us feel so welcome even without her physical presence. The house is beautiful, comfortable, and very clean as well. I was amazed by how much care she took in making the guests feel so welcome and taken care of. The room was filled with so many amenities, including a microwave, coffee, tea, protein bars, lotions, shampoos, all kinds of different things. A very pleasant stay, even though I only spent one night there. I would definitely come back again.
As always, clean, cozy and neat. I love this place.

I enjoyed meeting my hosts when I arrived around dinnertime. They were very gracious in responding to my text message that indicated I was running an hour behind the agreed upon time. I found their home welcoming, and the room provided for me safe, comfortable, and inviting. The instructions were clearly stated. I had a wonderful stay!
Had a great stay. David and Elizabeth are very accommodating and kind. Was not my first stay here, and I would definitely stay again.

Elizabeth and Dave (and their dog Donny) were AWESOME! They were very friendly and accomodating and they truly made me feel at home. They even invited me to hang out with them and eat dinner with them. (Side note: Elizabeth is an amazing cook!) As for the room, it was very clean and comfortable. The neighborhood was quiet and it wasn't too far from the downtown area. I would definitely stay here again and I would recommend this place to friends and family traveling to the Austin area. The price is right, the location is ideal, and the hosts are amazing.
Elizabeth was very accommodating during our one night stay. She left towels and toiletries in our room, and everything was very clean. She was also very welcoming and friendly.

The place is as described. The house is in a quiet and safe location. Elizabeth and David were great hosts. She was also very helpful to me during my search for a place to live as I am new to the area.

A very nice, well-kept older QUIET neighborhood close to shopping and a Gold's gym, and probably two minutes from 183 (before it becomes toll). There is offstreet parking, which in an older suburban neighborhood with narrow streets is a *real* score.I was warmly welcomed, the room was large with a desk, and there was a large yard with a deck. The A/C is very good, always important in Texas. The closet is large, and there is a microwave in the bedroom, with tea, etc. The shared bathroom was old, but clean, nicely decorated, and very serviceable. THE MATTRESS IS UNCOMFORTABLE. Be aware.There was a dog, but I only saw it when I arrived. It was very quiet the remainder of the time I was in the house.
Loved this house, with great vibes and very friendly host, who took care of us.

My husband & I stayed in the Green Door condo with my brother and his wife for a long weekend bumming around Austin. Everything about our stay was terrific -- the condo is clean, outfitted with everything you need (dishes, cookware, towels, wifi, space!), and has a great vintage/retro vibe. It's located in a quiet and peaceful residential neighborhoods, but is within walking distance to all the SOCO shops and eateries and an easy drive to everything else in Austin. We were really pleased with our stay -- highly recommended!
The host canceled my reservation 16 days before arrival.
The host canceled my reservation.

I really enjoy the boutique hotel experience, and Susan and Anthony have created a space with all the perks of a boutique hotel but with the added advantage of being in a very lovely, quiet neighborhood. I did need to ask some questions/ request something, and the communication was always fast and helpful. My request was accommodated, no problem. I'm not sure a hotel would have done so. Here are some of the things I loved: the Japanese bath (the entire bathroom was sparkly clean), the sheets, the above and beyond comfy mattress, and the supply of ear plugs (I was attending a music fest). The walk around to the apartment reminded me a bit of a spa I've been to in New Mexico, even with the faintest, most relaxing sound of crickets.
Susan is a fantastic host. Great communication. Lovely neighborhood. Short drive away from all the popular tourist sites. Highly recommend!

Susan made me feel welcome from the moment that my reservation was accepted, and that continued throughout my stay. Shortly after the reservation was confirmed I received the very comprehensive stay details that I needed to be prepared for my arrival and check-in. As I learned after I arrived, her description of the apartment was just as accurate as the online description and photos that were provided. Arrival and check-in was smooth and effortless, and the apt. had all of the amenities that one might expect and then some. From the Nespresso teas and coffees, flavored waters, microwave and refrigerator to the more than adequate toiletries, Susan seemed to have thought of everything that the traveler might need. The unit was clean, the bed very comfortable, the air conditioning great even with 100-plus degree days. Located in a very pretty, quiet neighborhood, I won't hesitate to book here again. Thanks to Susan and her husband for providing a true "home away from home".

Susan was an extraordinary host. The house is a beautiful contemporary home in a beautiful, leafy neighborhood filled with gorgeous homes. The unit itself is filled with very nice high-end linens. There are so many lovely touches: decorating, having everything we needed at hand. We have stayed in many Airbnb locations, and Susan's may well be the very best we've experienced.She sent extensive information about restaurants and things to do in Austin before we arrived so we could plan our time. If we return to Austin, we will stay with her again!
Nice place in a quiet neighborhood. Would highly recommend. Host was very helpful in making sure we were comfortable.

Indeed, the place is a funky, artsy space that was comfortable, clean and safe. The neighborhood is interesting and Sevylla's place is super close to Onnit Academy/Gym so it's a great place to stay if you're taking a certification course there. Easy access to the freeway and a quick jaunt to all the cool places in the downtown area without being in the hustle and bustle of the city. The neighbors have roosters, so it's a good idea to have ear plugs.
Wonderfully communicative and warm.

The studio is funky and hip, a great place to stay only a short drive from downtown. This place is a Super gem. The neighborhood is very family-friendly so don't expect lots of party noises, although the roosters in the neighborhood might wake you up if you're a light sleeper, so bring some earplugs. Personally I really enjoyed the environment and all of the unique birds (greckles, starlings, roosters and chickens). If you want to take the bus, it goes right by the front door. This was my second visit to Sevylla's Studio and I will definitely be coming back for my next trip to Austin

Our top 5 reasons you'll want to stay here and nowhere else: Location - 15 minutes via rental car to downtown, 1 hr 20 min to San Antonio (must make the side trip!) and less than 3 hours from Dallas for ease of flights. Meticulously cleaned and organized in the flat. Everything you need for cooking (small countertop burner), fridge, dishware and more. Folder and guidebook left in the unit for planning activities, and an additional e-mail from Drew with local favorites. Privacy. We would see Drew and Simone in passing, and it felt like saying hello to neighbors. Very comfortable and private entrance into the flat, noise was never an issue.4. Water pressure in the shower. If you travel often, you know how important a good shower is. While slightly tight for two adults, the shower is well built into the private bath off the flat.

How do you spell disappointment.I stayed at this location two years ago & thats why I decided to stay again.First of all the minute you walked in there was a stench that I could not figure what it was until the next morning when the cat was at the front door waiting to come in...it was obvious by this cats refusal to go away that he/she was familiar with coming inside.So then it hit me what that smell (Website hidden by Airbnb) great if you are a cat lover and don't mind smelling cat urine.Second, if you leave blankets around, don't leave the ones with blood on them.And how about putting a mattress cover on the mattress. Will never stay here again..and would not recommend anyone to stay there either.

We recently stayed in Sarah's cottage, and while there are some very nice things about it, sadly our experience wasn't as overwhelmingly positive as everyone else's. Positives: the cottage is cute and nicely decorated, with a really nice bathroom (great shower!) and a comfortable bed. It's also quiet, well located and with easy access to the rest of Austin and beyond. Negatives: the WIFI is almost non existent. When we did manage to connect, the signal was so weak it took a long time to load just a single page. As international travellers who can't use data while roaming and rely on free WIFI, this was very frustrating, especially as the property is advertised as having internet. The cottage could also do with some dusting / cleaning. It wasn't too bad (the main things, i.e. bathroom / bed were clean) but things like the fridge, shelves, floor etc. needed some attention. And finally, we also found the host unresponsive and not particularly helpful.

I never met Sara. The only communication was text messages wanting to know whether we could leave early on thanksgiving so it could be cleaned for next guests. Perhaps she was gone. The house was in a quiet backyard with trees, close to my daughter and the cherrywood coffeehouse where we went everyday. The bed was really really comfortable.The only problems we had were an electric plug near the bed that didn't work and the refrigerator froze all our food even tho it was turned down low.

A true gem, close to the city centre of Austin. A safe, quiet and beautiful area. The house is clean and has everything you need including dish washer, washing machine and dryer. Comfortable beds. I highly recommend this place.

Location:Very secluded even though the highway is so close. You pull into a private residential street and then pull into their even more private tree-lined driveway. Very nice peaceful stay. If you need to keep in touch with the hosts, their house is just further down the driveway. On site hiking paths was awesome. Probably would've braved going down the trails more had I had better shoes. The whole property in general looks like an artistic public garden, a hidden jewel. We ended up bringing our car, which makes it easier to travel around and get things that we needed. Amenities:Modern decor, cute breakfast nook, fruits, pastry, snacks, water bottles, coffee/creamer, cups/plates/bowls, extra blankets, books/magazines about Austin, plus all the things you would expect from a hotel except better. They even provided things you didn't expect (like a colander!) but it was a pleasant surprise and we made use of these items.

I would not recommend renting any house from this host because the house he rents out they are unsanitary the bed the couch carpet walls they were all dirty I question the The Host he said we are germophobic if we wanted cleaner house we should pay more. So we left and checked in to local hotel.
Very good house with an even better host. Offered us another house when one of our colleagues developed allergies in the house and was very friendly and fast in all answers
Cozy and well-located. High marks for cleanliness. I have no negative to report. Would certainly reserve this backhouse again- the chickens even grew less wary of this traveler.

I don't love leaving negative reviews, but this was disappointing at best. The neighborhood is so Austin kooky, and the studio itself, though pretty rustic, has a cool funky vibe. But the black mold we found under the toilet seat, the grime we wiped out of the shower, the two-inch roach we killed, and the extraordinarily uncomfortable bed made us feel like we'd been swindled. I wouldn't let a friend stay there for free in its present state.

The Birdhouse was exactly as described. It was simple and convenient for two of us who mostly just needed and affordable place to sleep and shower as we adventures around the city. We loved the neighborhood and although we only saw Elizabeth once, she was very friendly.

The bedrooms were extremely cluttered with boxes and duffle bags; closets were full of boxes, books, and an extra mattress; other personal items cluttered up the living room and there was leftover food in the fridge. While the apartment appeared to have clean sheets and a plethora of clean towels, the apartment was not nearly as clean as a hotel would be. There was a layer of dust on most of the furniture. The worst offense though was that the showers were not cleaned and he left considerable amounts of bath products in them such as loofahs and a squeegee. All of this could be fixed by a good scrub from professional cleaners. While east Austin was definitely walkable from the apartment, it was farther than we had expected based on the write up (and not something you'd want to do in heels!). The write up of the apartment was misleading in other ways. The write up proclaims that there is a fully stocked beer fridge, but fails to mention it is not for visitor use.
Christian was flexible with check-in and his apartment was just as described«è_«è_«è_very clean, comfortable, and within easy walking distance of all of Austin's downtown offerings.

I cannot recommend staying at this apartment.It was not clean:There was black dust falling off of the ceiling fans and oozing out of the air vents.The shower had not been cleaned and there was a black hair ball on the shower floor.The coffee maker had molded coffee left in the filter holder.The building is currently being treated for mold.My adult son found guns under his bed.There was no place to hang out clothes because the closets were jammed full of stuff.Carpets were filthy dirty and had not been vacuumed.We chose not to spend much time there and tried to contact someone at airbnb. This was not an easy task, they don't make it very easy to find a customer service phone number. I finally was able to contact them when I arrived home and they sent me an email request for my opinion.Never again!

Erik and Crystal's place is right in the center of downtown Austin, which makes it perfect walking distance to everything. Erik was a great host who's easily contacted and accommodating to all his guests. Could not recommend this place anymore to someone visiting Austin for the first time like myself.
Quiet and comfy place.
The condo is in a great location.
Absolutely nothing negative to say about our stay at Alex's place. Our stay was was amazing couldnt ask for better hosts. Alex and David made us feel at home!

We really enjoyed staying here for our recent bachelor party of 8 guys in Austin. It is in a perfect location that is walkable to all of the happening places downtown. It is a clean, modern condo with very convenient access thanks to the key code doorlock. The only negatives were:- This is an 8 person place, not 10. There are 3 king beds and a pull out. I do not have any idea where you sleep 2 more people. - A couple little things like no bathroom vent fans (a big problem with 8 dudes eating BBQ and drinking beer) and the TV not working very well.Overall it was a great place to stay and I would definitely stay there again.

Overall we enjoyed our stay. The host did mention in the check-in instruction that voices in the hallway carry easily through the windows so I'd encourage any guest to bring ear plugs and eye mask. (We stayed over the mardi gras weekend.) The unit is on 3rd floor in an apt/condo complex with secured gates. Location is very safe and convenient where there are great restaurants and bars within walking distance. Our self check-in was easy and had enough towels to use. We also enjoyed ESPN channels.

Pro: Great location, in the heart of downtown, close to restaurants, bars and shoppingCons: Cleanliness is an issue, dirty, makeup stained sheets were in a ball on the bed. Bathroom not clean, shower curtain has mold on it. Updates like new paint job and thorough cleaning needed.

I can't think of a negative thing to say about this place. The house itself is lovely, peaceful, and well stocked. The fold-out futon was super comfortable, and was way more secluded than I was expecting (you don't have a door but it still feels like a private room). The balcony was so peaceful and great for watching weird Austin birds. 5 min walk to a bunch of great restaurants and coffee shops. It took us about 30-40 mins to walk to the Blanton/Bullock museum area.Non-dog people should be fine here. The dogs will totally keep to themselves after one quick bark and sniff on first meeting you. They'll be friendly to you only if you make the first move after that, and otherwise they'll ignore you. For dog people, these dogs are the cutest and really A+ at receiving belly rubs.We needed to cancel our first night and extend our last night by a day (thanks, new England weather) and Michelle was so sweetly accommodating about both last-minute changes.
Kathleen was not fair and I would not recommend using her as a host.

description of listing is accurate. RIGHT next to the convention center. Everything was great but I would recommend bringing ear plugs if you like to sleep in "silence" because you can hear people walking by on the street or outside of the apt.
Perfect downtown location, place was nice if a little basic and unfortunately surroundings were very loud!

Hospitality abound...Jake is an amazingly thoughtful and generous host. This private sanctuary was just what the Dr. ordered. Quiet, quaint, quality amenities and surroundings. There was a warm blueberry loaf, baked from scratch, waiting on the counter, just for us. They have thought of eveything you may have forgotten, including milk, juice, shampoo, needle and thread and a heated pool!They even thought of the rainy nights and have Uno, Scrabble, Trivial Pursuit and remember Spirograph? We played them all. My WiFi addicted 15 and 17 year olds played with Leggos and actually laughed out loud, with us. Thank you Jake, Kelly, Rabbit and Bear.

We were unimpressed with the outside surroundings of the house and cottage. We had to park on the street and then carry your luggage from the street through the gate down the driveway to the back of the house. This wouldn't have been as much of an ordeal had there not been large tree branches limbs and twigs strewn across the driveway. After going to dinner and returning after dark there was no lighting and my husband tripped over this debris trying to navigate back to the cottage. Another issue, although I LOVE dogs, was the large dog that was somewhat intimidating due to barking and jumping onto the window each time we had to walk by the main house. The bed was very comfy too. The only negative inside was the lack of a curtain on a large window that left us having to dress and undress in the bathroom. It was within walking distance to a few wonderful restaurants, which was great. Overall the experience was not great. I do believe just a couple tweaks and it would improve the experience greatly.

I'll start with the pros: This space was clean and cute. Plenty of space for a couple (we also had our toddler with us and if you bring a pop-up crib, it should be just fine.) The apartment has it's own entrance and parking space, which was very nice.Now the negatives: The most frustrating part of our experience was the alarm system. We received a very thorough run down of the house via an iphone app provided by the property management company who deals with this listing. But there was no mention of an alarm. When we arrived, we noticed that the alarm would annoyingly beep every time we opened the door. My tech-savvy husband tried to turn that feature off and ended up arming the thing further. When we opened the door again, a crazy loud alarm went off. There was ZERO information with the code to disarm it and when we called the property management, it took them ages to track it down. We ended up getting a visit from the fire department and everything.

No real issues. Place is clean and nice and well-maintained. Easy to access. Great, super convenient location. Parking isn't really an issue, either; plenty available nearby.Only negative thing is that it can be a little loud if it's a holiday / busy weekend in one of the bedrooms, due to the fact that it faces the street. Chalk it up to being near everything.

Mollie was great and so easy to communicate with. She shared us on a long list of great restaurants in the area to visit, which was very helpful. The house has a great location with several bars and restaurants just a short walk away. The house very cute and eccentric but I would not recommend for 4 adults as two of the beds are children's bunk beds.

Clear, detailed communication and very responsive host/property manager. Clean space and in very close proximity to everything. Do NOT recommend for business travel as it does not offer very private rooms and would not fit 10 people comfortably. We had 6 and even that seemed like too many when you are staying with your coworkers. Acoustic in the space were not great, you could hear what every person was doing, even with the door closed. A little overpriced for what you get. This house would be great for younger travellers looking to attend the music or film portion of SXSW but really do not suggest it for business travel and do not suggest trying to fit 10 people.
Great place
The location of the apartment is very convenient and closely located to the 6th st, Rainey and Congress. However, the price during the weekend is way to high in comparison to other properties.

While perfectly situated in the heart of Austin, this apartment is not very nice and feels like a place to host a bachelor party weekend. Pictures weren't the reality - no art on walls, no nice cushions... no towels out... very bare bones. The carpets were dirty and although the place had been cleaned well, it just felt old and icky. Great for young party crowd, perfect actually, but I wouldn't recommend for a family/work trip.

Travelers beware: this place is a dumpster fire. the beds were absolutely disgusting. The mattresses are crap, they all sink in the middle, the sheets/comforters are NOT what's pictured in these photos. They are like 30 year old, smelly, nasty rags thrown over ancient pillows and mattresses. No one was comfortable. Everyone felt dirty. The floors/walls/carpet/furniture are all covered in stains (some of which will make you just not want to know what happened before you got there). The furniture was not what was promised. At all. Beds are all different, 4 tiny twins shoved upstairs as an example instead of the one nice queen it shows. Also, we only had one half of a couch (two seats) and a random chair that didn't match anything and was disgusting. No pillows or nice coffee table as listed in photos. MOLD. Black mold in the vents, on the walls. The whole place feels moist. YUCK. The pool was closed. Why? FECAL MATTER CONTAMINATION. _«è__«è_.

I would NOT recommend staying in this place. It was very obviously not cleaned before I checked in (dirt and dust on the floors, grime in the shower). There were no trash cans, hangers, or cleaning supplies - the bare minimum. The air conditioning was NON functioning and left a gaping hole in the window for bugs to enter. Absolutely the worst Airbnb experience I've ever had.
Alex's place is adequate, though a bit more run-down than the photos indicate. The location is very convenient.
Perfect location-- close to downtown and located in a safe complex. Would highly recommend to others looking for a place to stay while visiting Austin.

It sounded like something must have been broken. We sent Brock a courtesy note through the Airbnb app then around 11pm, letting him know he may want to check it out.The response was quite surprising, and felt aggressive. At 3:40am we received a message back asking if we'd ever heard a washing machine before. 10-20 minutes later, another message saying that if it bothered me so much I could use the on site pay machines (even though laundry is listed as an amenity at his location). And even went on to say, «è_«è_«è_Wanna know what my complaint is? Getting woken up at 11:30 on a Monday about a loud washing machine. Poor you.«è_„ùWe were very taken aback by his approach, and tried to de-escalate the situation. To this, he ended up responding again in the morning (in a seemingly more calm manner) that he would have a look after we checked out after our stay. After such an alarming response, we didn't know what to do. So we left it at that, and feel right that futures guests should be aware .

We planned to stay for four nights and left after one due to feeling unsafe and uncomfortable. The unit is very rundown, and photos and listing description are inaccurate and outdated. Unit does not have a pullout sofa or chairs in dining area that are in the photo. Multiple safety and comfort issues: this is a ground floor unit and the windows were unlocked on arrival and difficult to lock due to broken lock mechanisms, very difficult to find the parking spot, had to unload the dishwasher of previous guest, lack of toilet paper, moderate amount of mold on shower curtain, ceiling lights in bedroom not all functional, multiple table lamps with either missing lightbulbs or burnt out, main bed and pillows not comfortable, shower temperature extremely difficult to control (scalding or too cool), 4-inch cockroach in the bathroom, AC vent above main bedroom door loose and noisy. Plus, the host expects that you load the dishwasher, start laundry, and take out the garbage even though there is an $80 cleaning fee.

I'm not sure if it was the circumstance (arriving at 1am in a new city), but as a young woman on her own, I would not recommend staying here. I'm used to living in bare bone amenities, but I was sketched out by this listing. I felt uncomfortable, didn't have much privacy, couldn't really sleep, and couldn't muster up the courage to use the bathroom by going through Cody's room while he was sleeping in there. The paranoia I experienced was not worth the money I saved.

I did not feel uncomfortable or sketched out with bed/bathroom arrangement, as some others have, just a bit awkward. More privacy would have been nice, maybe in the form of a curtain around the bed, as another reviewer suggested, but I was out of the room most of the day and he was often out or asleep when I was there, and even when we were both in the flat at the same time, the set-up didn't bother me much. However, I unfortunately did not sleep very well for the 4 nights I was there. The mattress seems to be well-used and consequentially sags a bit in some areas. I have slept on a variety of couches, beds, and futons at various hotels/hostels/Airbnb locations and usually do not have problems, but my back began to bother me after the 1st night and still does even 36 hours after I have left. Overall, my experience was fine and not as personally uncomfortable as some of the other reviewers', and between the listing and reading reviewer's comments, there were no surprises, pleasant or unpleasant.
Easy In, Easy Out. No complaints. Great Location. I'd Book It Again.

BEWARE!! This Airbnb made me realize that I am not a minimalist traveler if that means I won't have a clean place to shower. The shower is covered in mold inbetween the tiles and on the grout. The underside of Cody's bathmat has mold growing on it. The toilet was left with dried fecal matter for many days. The windows and vents are covered in dust. If you have allergies they will be triggered by this, as the AC is often on because of the hot Texan weather. Bathroom situation is a bit awkward, it would not have been too bad if at least the bathroom was clean. Kitchen area is also filthy with dried food all over the microwave and he uses his kitchen as a storage area as well where he leaves piles of papers on top of the stove top. Window curtain which is right next to the bed is broken so it provides little coverage from the outside, which was a bit uncomfortable because Cody's apartment is ground level. Walls are paper thin and refrigerator is broken and makes startling thumps and noises.
Cody is accommodation and hospitable host.
Quant and cute.
It's fine
Within a few miles of everywhere you want to be.
Overall a nice stay
10/10 would stay again

My recent stay with Martha and Paul was wonderful. I ended up book with Martha last minute and received a confirmation within 30 minutes. They were both extremely friendly and knowledgeable of the city and recommended all the great places I need to see. The room was clean and cozy and couldn't have picked a better place to stay when in Austin!!!ThanksChris

Our view of this accommodation is quite different to others, maybe it's all about expectation. We have been traveling for about a month and this place was the most lacking in modern conveniences. No cable TV (CNN, HBO, Disney JR), no dish washer, no clothes washer/drier, water heater couldn't handle 2 consecutive showers and water pressure is rather low. It's almost 20 km to the Hamilton Pools (pictured with the listing). Interior design was tasteful but rooms are dark.

The owner also advertises 5 beds... two of the "beds" are 4 inch thick padding you put on the concrete floor and lay on. I attempted to call Steven about the uncomfortable heat twice and no one picked up. It wasn't until I called his partner that I received a response. Their "trick" to cooling the bedrooms was to close the air vents downstairs. Doing so wasn't difficult, but inconvenient. There is no real dining table, only the two seater you see in the first photo. The outdoor shower is filthy and full of rust. I didn't even want my dog to be rinsed off in it in fear of getting tetanus. Lastly, and most disturbing, I get the feeling that Steven doesn't wash all of the bedding linens in-between reservations. I will say that we are currently in disagreement over an extra $50 he is trying to charge me for having dog fur on a futon that has a washable cover. This issue has nothing to do with my review and if you do book with this terrible host, you'll see how awful Steven is.

The check in at Jenny's was very easy. The air conditioning worked very well and the bed was super comfy. It was an easy walk to Downtown Austin. The construction was loud, but Jenny had told us about it. It was quiet at night.

Cute and love the old house. Jenny has it decorated cute and it feels very welcoming. Location is great and within walking distance of some cute restaurants on West 6th Street. I love how it's tucked away but still close to alot of great places.

Our stay started off on a pretty bad note, we arrived after 2 pm which was the check in time. There was a car parked in the spot we were supposed to have so we parked in the front of the house and told Angel but asked if there were any other places to park. We were then told we couldn't park there because that spot was for guests staying in the house(nobody stayed there while we were there so nobody was using the spot) but we weren't given any other options for parking. We went to drop our bags off in the camper but we were greeted by a woman blocking the gate so we couldn't get in who asked "what's this about?" Overall our stay was pretty comfortable. I would have liked to get into the camper at 2(or at least a warning that it wasn't ready) so we could have planned around it. Definitely wouldn't pay $100 again to stay there.

It's probably my fault for choosing to stay in a trailer. It's very bare bones. There is also a cat there that was constantly trying to eat my food, enter the shed, enter the bathroom shed with me.. I wouldn't do it again. The place is clean and it has running water and a toilet in a shed. I also liked the mini kitchen. It's just not for me. Again, probably my fault. I got caught up, I think, in the novelty and ignored the reality

Absolutely ADORED this camper! Super cozy and stylish! We had everything we needed and more. Loved seeing the neighbor's cats since they were so friendly. One of my favorite things was the outdoor shower... Try to shower at night if you can to catch a glimpse of the stars :) Would definitely recommend and will be staying again next time I'm in Austin!

The home accurately depicts the images and is aesthetically well designed in a great location in Travis Heights near South Congress, etc. Some quirks and things to note on value - one of the beds was very squeaky so we changed rooms and the beds felt like doubles. The HVAC unit is dated and super loud, which interrupted our sleep each night from constantly turning on at length... We had to raise our voices during conversation in the living room when A/C kicked on. Subjective complaint(s) - there's post-it notes all over the house that need to be pared down, in my opinion, and picked up in a concise one-pager in the welcome handbook if there's a need to nip the bud from on-going guest complaints and or issues inside the home (modern design = intuitive user experience). We felt like kids staying at a friend's house whose overprotective parents watch over us with all the notes and instructions posted everywhere, along with the lingering "we may see you during your stay" noted. 3/5

Crystal was easy to communicate with and quick to respond. We stayed here for my wedding weekend and it was perfect for our group. We even got ready at the house and had plenty of space. The house is nicely decorated and clean. We really appreciated being able to use the 2 car garage as well. The only con is that there is a bar directly behind the house that plays loud music until about 2 am. Other than that, we loved our stay and would highly recommend it for others!

The apt is the lower part of a duplex. I don't know if the upper part of the duplex is also an Airbnb rental but I was disturbed by the noise coming from above and in and out of the front door (some young guys who were very loud and slamming the door at 10pm, 2am). I guess you just need to go out a lot! There also seemed to be a lot of car alarms going off in the neighborhood. It is in a fantastic location to 6th street, a park and several shops/restaurants. There was some coffee, 1 Corona and bottle of wine and some chocolate provided which is thoughtful. Not sure if there was cable? There was a guide in folder but no remote? There is Netflix which is awesome. Keyless entry is good but I could not remember 10 digit code code and had to keep my phone on me at all times. Responsive host when I contacted her regarding a leak. Would stay again. Thank you!

The place was clean. Location is OK.Construction right outside the bedroom window and neighbors upstairs were quite loud so not the best of rests ever.The deck and porch were not what were really portrayed... the place is a little dated. The bedroom door doesn't close and there are no curtains on the from door so not the most private either.Impossible to find a plug to charge your phone unless you shift all the bedroom furniture to search behind beds and sofas. Bed wasn't the most comfortable.For the price I was charged I really wasn't pleased at all with what I found.

Mireille's apartment was about a 15 minute stroll to central downtown. It was a great place to be based in Austin. Mireille is very easy to communicate with and check in and check out was a breeze. For people that like to sleep in I would recommend ear plugs and you can hear the people walking upstairs.

The communication was good overall. I appreciated the company allowing us to have a late check out. However we were moved at the last minute to unit #504 which wasn't in great condition (marks on the walls, a big dent in the bathroom door, etc) my sheets had stains on them (though they were clean) and worst of all, there was an insect problem. We killed four giant bugs in the first 36 hours. The company sent a cleaning crew out right away and also set some traps, but since I found one bug in my bed I slept on the couch instead. The location is great -- I didn't mind the noise with ear plugs. But the bugs were gross and the place was not in great condition.
Noisy like the warning states but it is downtown Austin!! Ear plugs were in the bathroom and worked great! Place is clean, comfortable, roomy and great location.
n/a
Great location--a bit loud at night though, so make sure you're out making noise yourself instead of staying in.

Niki & Veronica's house is one of the best places I've stayed in. The Airbnb photos accurately capture the essence and feel for their house. Niki & Veronica were very communicative and friendly. The house is very convenient to everything East Cesar Chavez has to offer, including the Butler Trail. We'll be adding Niki & Veronica's house to our list of candidates when we return to Austin.

I had booked this apartment for a colleague staying in Austin for SXSW, and he could not have had better things to say about the apartment. The location was perfect for SXSW, and the apartment itself was very nice and clean. Alexandria was also extremely communicative.Definitely would recommend this location!

i came to austin for the weekend with some friends; we loved the place as well as the neighborhood. alexandria was a fantastic host- communicative & accommodating. absolutely would recommend this place to others.

Alexandria was an extremely communicative and available host that went above and beyond, going so far as to receive and deliver an overnighted package to me. The apartment is cute and comfortable. The A/Cs worked really well despite the extreme heat outdoors. Also the bar downstairs wasn't too loud even on Friday and Saturday nights. I ended up staying here alone and was a bit uncomfortable with the secluded entry and was disappointed that there were only door handle locks, not a deadbolt or chain. It was relatively tidy and clean but could use a refresh overall. I ended up enjoying and appreciating my stay here_ã”it was a good home base while I attended at conference at the Hilton, which was a 15 minute walk.

My family had to vacate this house after the AC failed in on a 100 degree day in July. I was unimpressed by Top Trip's efforts at fixing the AC, which wasted a whole day of our vacation. My and family and I will not stay at any of Top Trip's properties in the future because of this frustrating experience.The house itself was neither wonderful nor bad, merely meh in a way that would have rendered our stay there an entirely forgettable aspect of our vacation. It is located very close to attractions in South Austin that are enjoyable for adults, children and dogs alike. It has a nice back porch that is a pleasant spot for enjoying an evening breeze. Judging from other property reviews, Top Trip seems capable of addressing minor issues like an empty propane tank in the grill outside.They are not, however, ready to address a real issue like a failed AC unit on a Saturday night.

Not what I expected. The house is very small. It wasn't a terrible place to stay but here are a couple issues to be aware of. WiFi isn't good in the bedroom, there isn't a tv in the bedroom, the bedroom ISNT private the door opens easily and doesn't lock none of the doors lock, and they kept changing the temperature to a high temperature. Ok good things though include: peaceful place to be, clean, and good accommodations such as towlels, bedding, and blankets.

I hate writing negative reviews, and especially because Kevin was a nice host, but the only way to describe this place was "sub-standard." The most important thing to note is that it really isn't a two-bedroom apartment. There's a bed in the living room. I mean, you could see it as a two-bedroom with no living room. In any case you either have no common area, or you're using one of the bedrooms as a common area. The kitchen is small and very poorly equipped. Old cheap cookware and no spices (not even pepper when we arrived - only salt). It wasn't horrific - there were clean linens etc, but stuff like the old coffee, and parts of the apartment that clearly hadn't been swept or dusted for a long time. The bathroom was terrible - the tub was just disgusting and didn't drain. After a couple of minutes, you'd be ankle-deep in water.

Mari was very responsive and worked back and forth with me as we hammered out the details. She even admitted upfront that the location can be noisey, being right in the heart of downtown Austin (it really wasn't that bad at all!). The place is fantastic, especially for couples or a few friends staying in Austin, wanting to be in the center of everything. I live in Austin, but rented Mari's place out for friends visiting in town, so I'll add my austinite credibility here and say this is a great place to stay if you want to immerse yourself in Austin.
Great spot

Single-travelers beware: Good price and would definitely suit a group booking all together but terrible for single travelers wanting to relax at end of day. The fact you can hear every sound your neighbors make at all hours made me feel really uneasy anytime I was there hanging out in my own room. Great side of town and if you had the whole house booked (all three bedrooms) with people you know, you'd have a blast! I thought it was weird too that on checkout, the host asked guests to only leave a review if you gave them 5 stars. Come on guys.

My stay here was okay. The host responded quickly through Airbnb messaging, but wasn't very helpful in answering my questions. There was no hair dryer and the host did not provide one upon request. Also, there was a french fry on the floor of my room the first day I moved in. No one came to take out the trash for days. There were also a bunch of dirty dishes in the dish washer for days. House keeping came in on one day and only stayed about 30 minutes to clean. I guess you get what you pay for. The amenities are minimal, but overall my stay wasn't bad.
Thanks for the hospitality! A great place at an unbeatable price!

4 words - do not stay here! I've been a loyal AirBnB user for the past 4 years, and have not had a negative experience. The bed sheets hadn't been changed and washed, and I found stains and a few pieces of stray hairs. When I explained that this was a problem to the host, this was their response...I didn't get much sleep last night and have been traveling all day, and was hoping to relax and hit the sack early, when I stumbled on the unsightly scene - stray hairs and stains on the sheets from your previous guest!Unfortunately, the host took too long to respond, 8 hours to be exact, and by then, I was fed up. I wanted to give the host an opporunity to make things right, but they didn't even address the core issue, which was that I wanted the room to be cleaned. Although I did receive a refund for the rest of my stay, I still had to pay for my 1 night stay, which in principle I shouldnt have paid for.

My group and I stayed at Annie's for the new years and it was a fantastic place. Although we had a group of five, the place was big enough to hold 7-8. It came equipped with towels, a washer and dryer, and a dish washer. It's also a block away from the grocery store so you can get whatever you need. Proximity to 6th street was important to us and this was about a mile and a half away. 5 star place

First things first....Ty's place is nice. It's as it looks in the photos, but it's worth noting that the third bedroom is off the kitchen separated by a curtain. So in theory the kitchen and 3rd bedroom are the same room. The backyard is amazing and the bathroom is really nice as well...now, on to Ty. If you click my profile, you'll see i have over 50 Airbnb reviews, i'm a host and travel often. Ty pulled a fast one on us and then went missing. I booked a 5 night rental, more than a month in advace. The next morning (not even 12hrs after booking), i realized I only needed 3 nights, not 5. Ty has instant book turned on his reservation, 3 night minimum. So i messaged Ty and said, "hey, can you change it to 3 nights". He didn't respond...i emailed, i texted, i (Website hidden by Airbnb) response. A week goes by he says "I'll get back to you", he doesn't. Finally, I call Airbnb, they reach him and he says "If they want to change for 3 nights, they have to pay $600".

Don't even. No WiFi. No TV signal. No response from host. I guess you could read -- Oh wait, light bulbs burned out. Smelly, stiff towels. Terrible location with no direct access to major roads although adjacent to busy highway (loud). Maybe book if you just need a bed for a night but sleeping in your car might be a better option. GROSSLY OVERPRICED for marginal accommodations. I couldn't get out of there fast enough.

Here are the reasons I would never stay at Stephanie's Air B&B again & would only suggest this place as a ABSOLUTE last resort.. unfortunately. My full experience so prevent you from wasting your money And time. I arrived and there was no hot water. Everyone knows that you're guests should be put first when you're hosting,that's means taking extra steps & double checking everything before your guests arrives just to lessen the possibility of any unnecessary inconveniences that could have been prevented for your new guest, Because everyone knows, FIRST impressions mean everything. Your guest is paying for the fees listed to stay at YOUR B&B. Your guest chose YOUR B&B out of hundreds of others for specific reasons based on what your listing advertised. Your job as a host is to make sure you fulfill everything you advertise on your page.

It's a beautiful, spacious and cozy condo. It is well equipped with the basics such as the washer dryer, dish washer, TV, basic bathroom linen/toiletries etc. Very comfortable place. The building is at a great location! Great food and theaters, groceries etc at walkable distance. Gym and pool and coffee in the lobby are great additions! I had a great time.

Best airbnb we ever stayed in! Even though this was a house - the service and amenities made us feel like we were staying in a 5 star hotel. Right next door is the Josephine House, a farm-to-table restaurant where we enjoyed delicious meals. We found out they actually manage this airbnb, which made our experience so unique. We hope to come back next year during SXSW. Thank you Marjorie!

The Waterston House had all the amenities of home with a very nice backyard which we enjoyed later in the day. In the neighborhood was a handy grocery store which sold just about anything one might need. Also, enjoyed the top-notch restaurant next door for after dinner deserts and apritifs, and the proximity to downtown Austin. All together, a very nice stay.

Marjorie has a beautiful home that is perfectly located on the edge of town- just close enough to be walking distance from downtown but far enough away to be peaceful. There are also a lot of cute cafes and restaurants right next door. I wish we could have stayed longer. My family and I had a great time.

Overall, a spectacular experience. The only slight downside was that it was a hike to get into downtown Austin, but certainly not insurmountable with a rental car/uber.The pluses way outweighed the location! The big 2 positives were the airstream itself, and the ridiculous hospitality of the Shannons.The airstream itself was super nice - a blend of vintage style and modern amenities. There's a fridge, dish washer, fully stocked kitchen, TV w/ cable, a big nice bed, a porch with great lighting for evening drinks. Everything was nice and worked well.The hospitality was on the next level. The Shannons left us a bottle of tequila and cocktail ingredients, coffee, cereal, local milk in glass bottles, candy.... Most impressively, on morning one we woke up to a tray left on our front porch with delicious breakfast tacos and OJ. Couldn't have nicer things to say about the Shannons, who felt like old friends who were letting my girlfriend and I stay with them on their property.
Our stay at the mansion was great - the property is adorable! I wish we could have stayed longer than just a weekend.
A great mix of contemporary and vintage makes this the perfect place to stay in a city like Austin.
Cute house! And close to many cool hill country destinations. Great for a weekend stay.
This tiny house is so cozy and cute! CJ and Katie were so attentive and quick to answer any question!

I'll start off by saying the house was very clean and was in a great location and I slept very comfortably. HOWEVER, the accuracy of her listing is completely misleading. BUYER BEWARE this house is listed as an "entire home" but there is an older guy that lives upstairs! We were appalled to find someone else walking around in the middle of the night and in the kitchen in the morning considering I was walking around in my sleepwear. Our safety was truly questionable as we had no idea of another guest.Our host was very rude to say the least. She would only communicate with us at 4am and would constantly berate us with convictions and threatened to evict us at 4:30 in the morning because of my service dog. She was very hostile with all her responses and chose to argue with us about the wifi password. It wasn't until the last day of our stay that we received the correct wifi password. We also had trouble with the AC because the man that was staying there turned the air from 69 to 78 every morning around 6AM.
Peaceful, quiet neighborhood, easy to find. Great WiFi...overall, a great space!

Patty and her husband were wonderful (and experienced) hosts. Their house is lovely and in a quiet neighborhood. I appreciated the WIFI. You do need to have a car to stay here, as it is in the suburban area and not the downtown of Austin. Thanks so much!

Awesome location, close to the freeway. Very friendly hosts. Fast Wifi . Towels and other toiletries offered. Ample parking. Quiet neighborhood and total value for the money. Just make sure you check in before 10 PM , since that's one of the house rules. Considering Austin is known for its night life, people might miss out on that .

Due to a cancellation from another host, I needed to pick up a reservation on short notice in the Clarksville neighborhood. Mireille's place was one of the few available, and at good value.Location was excellent and easy to find, though I wished it was just a bit further from a busy intersection that generated a fair amount of road noise.Beds were clean, comfortable, and the fans + indoor AC units kept things cool during the warm days. The renovated kitchen and bathroom were a plus. Wifi worked well without any hassles.

4 out of 5 stars. Pros - You cant find a better view. You cant find a better location. You're in the heart of it all. This is a beautiful apartment and Jay was a fantastic host. Cons - Saying this place accommodates 6 is a stretch. Their was no air matress, only a love sac in the living room. The wifi didnt work and the TV could only stream (since there was no internet, it was useless). The neighbors are not nearly as polite about music as this listing asks. This place is LOUD. Rainey street goes most of the night and the neighbors right next door partied every night. All that said, its still a great place to stay. Nobody stays this close to the action expecting to stay in the room and watch Downton Abbey. This is a place to act as a base to experience all the great that Austin has. And it works perfectly for that. Sleep, shower, shave and out. Repeat as necessary.
Jay was an excellent host! Highly recommended!
Prime location. We had 5 of us on a trip over the 4th of July weekend and the apartment was perfect for our needs. Right on Rainey with enough size for the group to hang out in.
Great location! Beautiful amenities.

LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION, literally in the heart of all Rainey St bars and restaurants. Very nice building, new and very chic. Jay was perfect host. Very responsive, but not intrusive whatsoever. Exactly as described. Would stay there again and highly recommend.
Martin was a great host. Super communicative, helpful. Location was ideal, clean, and quiet!
Martin was a great host--he responds to messages immediately and even let me check in early! The place was no frills, but for the price and location, it can't be beat!

Wonderful experience from start to finish! Everything was as expected per the listing and more. Jim was quick to respond to my inquiries before arriving and accommodated our late check-in (and late check-out). He even furnished the place with some snacks and beer to welcome us! The duplex is located in a safe and quiet neighborhood a few miles from downtown. It's definitely spacious, and it was very clean and well stocked upon arrival. It has 2 leather couches and a TV with an HDMI port (as well as Netflix). There's a washer and dryer in the garage in addition to a bicycle for making quick trips to the gas station or convenience store. The WiFi works great, and the 2 large bedrooms have amazing beds in them. The kitchen is stocked with everything you need. Hanging out on the large deck out back is very pleasant at night in the summertime. This place was perfect for the 5 of us. I really can't think of a single con, so you can't go wrong with this place. Jim will certainly help you out if you need it.

Jim was great at communicating prior to our stay, and even picked us up from the airport. He walked us through the home and made sure we were comfortable with everything. He checked up on us via text to make sure everything was going well. Overall, a great stay in Austin!

My husband, brother-in-law, and I stayed at Jim's for 4 nights. The house was clean, well stocked with food and drinks, and in a safe neighborhood. The beds were comfy and both bedrooms had plenty of room and light. The deck was wonderful and we saw some beautiful deer grazing in the evenings. The bus stop is just a short walk and downtown is only a 10 minute ride if you want to avoid dealing with traffic and parking. Jim's house is a great place to stay and I highly recommend it!

Librada met us the moment we arrived, helped us settle in, and made sure we had everything we needed -- from the wifi password to fresh towels to coffee and creamer for the next morning. The neighborhood was gorgeous and nicely situated -- near popular spots like South Lamar, South Congress, Barton Springs Pool and Zilker Park -- and the space was perfect for our needs. The cabin is nestled in a little forest of bamboo, making it super dreamy and very serene.

We came to Austin to attend our daughter's graduation from UT and stayed at Shelley & Carl's bungalow. It was everything we wanted: a bungalow in a quiet shady backyard with a very pleasant garden close to our daughter's apt. in Hyde Park. Perfect for two people. They had the fridge stocked with all kinds of beverages plus fixings for an oatmeal breakfast and several kinds of coffee. The bed was comfortable and there was enough hot water for my wife and I. The bungalow had a sitting area with a tv equipped with Roku and a love seat; the walls are decorated with Swiss skiing posters (from the 50s?). The wifi connection was fast, too. We had a post graduation celebration--including playing bocce--at the bungalow and they were very accommodating to us. They were very friendly and helpful; I hope we have the chance to visit again.

A+++++. This place is even cuter than pictured. Shelley greeted us, showed us around the bungalow, and even took the time to sit down and write out a list of places we could hike around Austin. There were little custom touches all over the bungalow, it was so clean and well-kept, and the small kitchen off the side was adorable and really nice to have. Also VERY central to everything in the city. Couldn't recommend this place more!!!

Extremely clean & comfortable accommodation set in an adorable little neighborhood. 5 mins drive from some fantastic foodie spots. In room coffee was a super bonus for this caffeine head. Everything well thought out with the traveler in mind. A+++

Nate's home is perfect for staying close to downtown Austin. His place is very clean and comfortable. The room felt just like staying in a hotel with a little refrigerator and coffee machine. He was more than gracious and easy to communicate with. I would definitely recommend his place as it definitely exceeded my expectations. A++
Super comfortable. Excellent communication. A+++

If you want an amazing Austin experience and only need a small and wonderful place to rest up, this is THE place. Beautiful studio equipped with everything! Amazing skyline atop the 5th floor lounge and outdoor patio! Seconds from the boardwalk! Incredible privacy, efficient check-in/out! A+ all around!!!

Brooke was a great communicator, just a text away whenever I had a question! The whole process was wildly easy and convenient. Her place was adorable and comfortable with all the luxuries a gal would need. When finding out I was new to Austin she even went out of her way to describe Austin neighborhoods and where I might like best. A+!
Amazing apartment. Perfectly appointed. We could tell it's a home and not just a rental thrown together. Host is a great communicator! A++ member of the air bnb community.
Outstanding host! Communicated very clearly on every aspect and her place was sparkling clean

Can't beat the location! Rainey St is noisey but the atmosphere is fantastic and it wasn't a problem sleeping at all. We stayed Thurs through Tues so arguably the busiest nights and we still had a relaxing time - we wanted a few chill out days at the end of a 5 week road trip, visiting from NZ. Apartment has everything you need. Well equipped kitchen. Lovely big bathroom. Washer and dryer in the apartment was very helpful for us! Spent a lot of time on the balcony soaking up the atmosphere from the street below, rooftop pool a treat, gym facilities great. Easy walking to the city, graffiti park, South Congress bats, Wholefoods, convention centre. Free parking worked out well once you know how it works. Easy 5 night stay. Could've stayed longer! Highly recommended. Thanks Juan
A+

Comfort: 4/5 This Airbnb was a fairly comfy gem very close to all the action in Austin. The bed was a little hard but absolutely fine for my liking. I had no issue getting sleep, especially with the great temperature and A/C system and the white noise makers. All of the amenities here make you feel right at home at this unique spot in the middle of Austin. Aura: 5/5 If you want a fun, artsy, homish vibe that is symbolic of Austin...look no further. Especially for lone travelers. This place has a great balance of practicality and modern colorful decor. In addition, the inspirational figures and quotes here are pretty awesome too.Other Positives: 5/5 Super unique experience in a great location. Communication was super easy as well as check in. Breakfast bars and a metric ton of Cafe Verona coffee for use. The movie and lounge rooms were sweet and Bill Murray is right there to keep an eye on you. Great airbnb for a great price.
Nice, clean house, and great location.
Great location near 6th Street!

This place is great for a large group that needs lots of beds, but it was not good for a family with young children. It is very close to a restaurant/bar that was incredibly loud until after 10:00pm, so my daughter couldn't sleep. She also woke up early due to what sounded like trucks unloading in the morning. I do not recommend for families looking to get restful sleep.

We would not recommend this house for families. The backyard was definitely not kid friendly. There were no stoppers in the tubs in order to bathe children. There was no kitchen disposal, so if one wanted to cook, that would be a consideration.
Scout was super dope and gave us great recommendations
Cancelled on me last minute during the holidays. Only 1% of rooms were available in Austin when they cancelled on me for no reason so I got gouged by a hotel. Terrible host.
Comfortable bed, quiet atmosphere, rested well.
Tremendous hospitality. Would stay again.
Bien par rapport au prix pour une ou deux nuits
Good stay
Great stay exactly as seen in pictures... good for quick crash pad
100 % recommend
Good place if you're on a budget!

We had a terrible experience. Initial communication and check in were great. The place was nice at first look. After the first day, the shower broke. I called and reported it and was told it would be fixed that day or the next. 3 days later, it still wasn't fixed and no communication regarding the problem. The dishwasher didn't work. We didn't discover that until the last day. 2 of the 4 nights, was awakened by people outside and barking dog. These noises continued for approximately 30 minutes each night. Quite times were suppose to be from 9:00 PM to 8:00 AM. I reported this too. We will not stay again.

DO NOT STAY WITH THIS HOST! TLDR: When we arrived to the Airbnb we found out Carly, the host, put us in a different apartment than the listing which was a much smaller, dirty apartment and tried to deny the switch. Carly is a dishonest host and does not deserve anyone's business. We booked with Airbnb for 8 people and expected to be staying in the same place that was listed. On our way there Carly sent us a different address claiming that the one on Airbnb was incorrect. When we showed up and looked in the new apartment is was obvious it was not the one pictured in the listing AND there was someone in there still cleaning from the previous guests. The entire place was filthy.
This is a great place to explore downtown Austin.
Easy.
Great place to stay.

Joch was a terrible host & I would never deal with him again. First off I was having trouble finding the unit & he never responded to my texts,Airbnb messages, or phone calls. Once I reached the unit I tried reaching him in regards to the TV not working & their being no toilet paper, he never responded. At about 11pm my boyfriend got fed up with him not responding and called him from his number. A woman answered the phone & said she would look for the Apple TV remote. Joch called back several minutes later & said that the last guest must have taken the remote & he would bring the remote along with toilet paper & that he would be their in less than 5 minutes. He never came, in fact he turned off his phone. Upon further inspection of the unit I noticed that throughout the whole bath tub their were these horrible orange stains. The toilet was filthy & their was no toilet paper! The kitchen was beautiful although cooking utensils were very minimal.

Our host did not provide instruction on which room was ours. Upon awkward investigation on our own, we found the previous guest's belongings in our room. Suitcase, items in the closet, items on the nightstand. Our host did not answer our calls or texts in a timely manner to assure us that our accommodations would be made right. A few hours later we heard from Maryam with sincere apologies about the situation. She told us that our bed sheets were being replaced with clean ones. We received a 20% discount for the inconveniences but I think our host is trying to juggle too much. She was going to allow the previous guest to check out late and rely on the guest to change the sheets. It did not work out well. We didn't arrive for check-in until 6pm so it's clear the host was taken advantage of or neither guest nor host can manage their calendars.

BUYER BEWARE this house is listed as an "entire home" but there is an older guy that lives upstairs! We were appalled to find someone else walking around in the middle of the night and in the kitchen in the morning considering I was walking around in my sleepwear. Our safety was truly questionable as we had no idea of another guest.Our host was very rude to say the least. She would only communicate with us at 4am and would constantly berate us with convictions and threatened to evict us at 4:30 in the morning because of my service dog. She was very hostile with all her responses and chose to argue with us about the wifi password. It wasn't until the last day of our stay that we received the correct wifi password. We also had trouble with the AC because the man that was staying there turned the air from 69 to 78 every morning around 6AM.

Sylvia worked with us on a very last minute weekend booking. The photos are pretty much spot on. A prime location and good value. Parking was easy, lots of places close by to eat and visit. Burned off all the calories from the Ice Cream Festival by walking to and from Fiesta Gardens :). We didn't go downtown much, but I could see this being a good place to sleep if you plan to drink and not drive. A few small cons, including the cute but a small clawfoot tub (I'm only 5'4" and I felt a little cramped.) and the fact that things could have been a little cleaner/fresher (crumbs/dirt on the floor, and musty towels). Also, you might want to bring a sleeping mask if you are sensitive to light -- I sleep like a rock but my friend had a hard time with all the ambient light from the windows + light curtains. All in all, a good first experience using AirBnb :)

The neighborhood was great and easy to navigate with Uber and walking. We really enjoyed checking out the homes and local businesses nearby. Fiona also provided a great list of restaurants to check out, which was helpful. Unfortunately, the studio itself wasn't very comfortable or clean for our stay. There was a musty smell that clung to our clothes, dust bunnies on the floor, spiderwebs and empty travel toiletries leftover from previous guests in the shower. It was also difficult to get a decent sleep due to the hard mattress and the neighbor's back-to-back parties that lasted until 4 AM on Thursday and Friday nights. Bathroom privacy was hard to come by because there is no door between the toilet and the rest of the studio, just a curtain. I must have missed that in the description.
